course.title: Subjectivities and Identities in Russia and Eurasia: Seminar
course.faculty_text: Terry D. Martin and Stephanie Sandler
course.description: Year-long bi-weekly seminar on collective and personal identities in the history, culture, and politics of Russia, Eastern Europe and Central Asia. Key questions: where and how are identities formed (in domestic, public, textual, and virtual spaces)? What factors constrain, promote, and shape identity formation? What theories of self-expression help us understand the region? How are identities and subjectivities similar? How are they different?
course.notes: Open to qualified undergraduates with consent of the instructors.
